reviewText: War of the Vikings is truly skill-based, therefore you'll find as the classes are balanced and the combat is harsh. You'll spend some time bleeding before you win your fights. Tactics and teamplay are important in every gamemode, and the squad system is a handy tool, although communicating with your team or squad through the game itself isn't easy.  If you want fast-paced hack&slash action like in Chivalry: Medieval Warfare, go play that game more. Combat isnt nearly as fast-paced in WotV, but still fun, highly competative, and if you're a competative spirit you'll love the challenge it brings. Combat and tactics in this game is something to Master. Buy it, but not at full retail price - Its still just a game you hop on once in a while to get your berserk on. 4/5 stars for this game in its category....Once they get their incredibly annoying stuttering bug fixed for high resolutions.

reviewText:
This game doesn't have half the skill ceiling of War of the Roses. You can master it in a few days of play, whereas Roses takes months to master. The graphics are ugly and dumpy, and the voiceovers are annoying. Everything feels cliched and arcadey. They seem to have self-consciously crafted a Chivalry clone, with influences from Roses and Warband.

They removed an entire attack direction (only 3 are left) and added unblockable power attacks. I've heard they actually considered an auto-block feature as well. The game is incredibly dumbed down. If Roses had been released as a sequel to this game instead of the other way around, no one would have batted an eye.

FatShark has added in a huge parry delay, so your blocks will only work about 60% of the time. Lag makes the game unplayable for competitive play if your ping is higher than 90. So, good luck fighting folks on the opposite coast, let alone players from Europe.

One nice thing: the arena mode is fast-paced and fun.

Very poor. Play Roses, Warband, or Chivalry instead.

reviewText:
This game is simply dissapointing, and often will make you angry. If i'd buy it somewhere like gamestop i would just give it back and take my money back.

Its basically War of the Roses with less content and new skins. Customization cant even stand near the one from WotR. Maps are good, but youll face enemies that looks the same over and over and over again. Less weapons to choose, less armours etc. I know historcally it MAY be correct... but its a game...

Oh, and if you imagine yourself going into battle dualwielding like in chivalry... guess what? Nope, wont get it here. Also, fighting system is mess, tutorial wont teach you anything, and even if, expect situations, when youll be in range of swing, and your weapon will just go trough the enemy without doing him any harm. And second after that his swing with shorter weapon than yours will kill you.

Graphics are good... but if you have a pc that is a little bit above the minimal system reqs. You will have to play it on LOWEST settings, or else youu watch a slideshow. And even if you somehow make it run smoothly, game will still freezez every few minutes for couple of seconds. Cause.... you now... thats why. I can run Witcher 2 on maximum quality on my laptop, also BF3 runs on high, War thunder on ultra.... and here i needed to turn everything off to just play the game for 2-3 minutes, before my laptop vents started acting like Boeing 747 turbine engines...

Finisher system from WoTR is out, and i think its a good decision, because you could have ridiculous moments back then, when your enemy were repedetely stabbing you in the skull, or was chopping your head off... and was interrupted in a split of second before animation end. And he had to start it again, wasting his and yours time, and also could be killed during this.
Also, stabbing atack is out. Dont know why, its kinda stupid imo.

The price... 24 euro for something that looks... just like DLC for WotR... with LESS CONTENT. ITs simpler, its smaller... its simply... worse. Dont repeat my bad and wait for some sells. Or dont buy it at all, and switch to M&B: Warband with some mods. And price of Valhalla edition is just a joke, trying to get the gamers money. Future content? Game was on early acces and you can still go to forum and read bug reports that havent been repaired since. I dont think any future content is worth additional 120e, considering the fact, that first theyll have to patch the whole thing, because now, in my opinion its not worth of playing, and probably wont be untill major patches... so something like.... months? Few months at least.

reviewText: TIL VALHALL
voteText: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
“To the glory of Valhaaallllaaaaaa!” I screamed into my mic as my Norse Marauder rose his axe high above his head and charged towards the Saxon scum. Shame I didn’t see that archer perched on the hill beside me. One arrow through the skull later and I was seeing the glorious gates of the Norse afterlife personally. By Odin it was worth it though.

Prepare to cackle maniacally as you land throwing axes square in enemies faces, cry tears of regret as you accidentally kill yet another teammate that got in your way, and yell Norse battle cries as you flail your weapon madly at anyone dumb enough to get close to you. War of the Vikings is a Third Person Arena combat game that lets you take control of the Norse or Saxons as they clout each other to death with sharp weapons over the various locales of 18th Century England.



The game features varying levels of detail and graphical settings, while the low end gives you a basic look to aid performance, when turned up the visuals can be quite stunning. The rural countryside’s and built up towns are all very beautiful to behold if you can ignore all the bloodstains and angry men stabbing each other. In particular water effects have a satisfying sunlight reflection to them when the settings are high enough and all of it adds to the atmosphere. Each of the soldiers you play as are designed very well, the two factions have distinctly different appearances. To top it off the game is accompanied by a full instrumental soundtrack which is reflective of the game’s time era. The drums, strings, and wind instruments are just great to listen to and the war music really helps get the bloodlust flowing during a large skirmishes.



The gameplay consists entirely of multiplayer online matches. When you join a game you are able to pick to be a Norse or a Saxon. The game offers a variety of gametypes with deathmatch and arena being the primary two. Deathmatch is as it sounds, two teams kill each other, respawning each time they die until one reaches a set amount of kills. Arena on the other hand lets the two team spawn and duke it out with each death being permanent. Once either team is wiped out, the points are awarded to the surviving one, and a new round then begins and winning team over the set rounds, will be the overall winner. There are other game modes that built on these two formulas, but at its core these are the main types you’ll find.

Fatshark boast a fully skill driven combat system for War of the Vikings. Combat utilises the mouse in full, forcing you to not only time your swings for maximum damage, but also consider which direction you swing from, defenders need to position and block correctly to avoid being hit from attacks. It only takes 1 to 4 swings to take down an opponent depending on the power of each swing, so it is in the best interest of the player to adopt a tactical play style and avoid taking damage. Attacks will be interrupted by hits too, so don’t expect to run in with an axe and crush everything through the pain.



The game clearly draws inspiration from the Call of Duty franchise. In some ways the inspiration is subtle, some others not so much. The biggest way is the class system. Assuming you don’t purchase any extra content (see below) the game starts you with 1 basic class. As you get kills you rank up, you unlock new classes with each rank and after a few ranks you’ll gain the ability to customise your own class, using in game money to purchase weapons for use. Once you get past this initial barrier the freedom is greater and having your own style of play helps you enjoy the experience furthermore.

As the game features no singleplayer mode the narrative is told entirely through the multiplayer battles. While no specific story is thrown in your face, the aesthetics and the voice over’s give you a feel for what you’re here to do. The game has various voice over’s where Saxons, or Vikings respectively call out to you as you play, updating you when the tide of battle falls from your favour or vice versa. When you lose a match you’re met with a relevant response from your invisible allies, equally when you achieve victory you are praised for your skill and it all adds to the immersion. The simplicity of the goal you’re set (kill the enemy) combined with the subtle voice-overs from you and your allies are surprisingly good at drawing the player in.



At time of writing I have clocked over 9 hours of play time within War of the Vikings. The multiplayer focus means that battles can always go differently, with enough maps of different sizes to vary up the gameplay feel. You can get a large amount of replay value alone from this, and with different game types to take your fancy you can mix it up and get continuous enjoyment for hours upon end. The developers Fatshark have mentioned that further content will be released down the line so this could bring even more replay value to an already great game.

In summary War of the Vikings is very good, but not without its negatives. The combat is challenging and it’s fun to duke out with other players. However, it can be frustrating when the skill difference between you and a foe is very high. It can feel like all players are better than you at times, which is demoralising. Once you get into the swing of the game it can be hugely entertaining, so long as you can stay physically connected to the game. Poor connection can make the game largely impossible to play. Combat is all about timing and coordination, both of which are hard to execute when your opponent is blinking all over the screen like a Mage with no cool down.



Some servers will even boot you if your ping is not consistently high enough, which is very annoying. Those that enjoy arena combat and deathmatch games will feel right at home, but for those with a penchant for less confrontational games will likely not enjoy themselves due to the entirely PvP nature of the game. For what it is though, War of the Vikings is a very well executed game. There’s a lot of enjoyment to be had if you can break past that initial struggle and break into the customisation and weapons.

War of the Vikings is available right now on Steam for £18.99. You can purchase/upgrade to the Blood Eagle Edition at £26.99 and it will come with an art book, soundtrack, special items and more. If that isn’t enough either, you can purchase/upgrade to the Valhalla Edition at £134.99 which will grant you all of the previous items, some extra in-game content, plus all current and future items free to purchase once the correct level is unlocked.

“SEE YOU IN VALHALLA BROTHER!”

For more game news, reviews, and videos visit http://www.push-start.co.uk/

reviewText: If your in the mood for a bit of the old ultraviolence, and don't feel like playing modern battlefield ghosts hardline black ops vietnam 27894 , and would rather have a go at a fellow with an axe or sword, than this should be on your to do list. This game plays similarly to the previous paradox titles, albeit with a little bit more silliness thrown in, which I enjoy. This game employs finishing moves, which people spam ad nauseum, to mostly not good results, numerous projectiles, not much in the way of armor,  and it is regularly updated with new content and fixes. The graphics really are pretty good, better looking than..... well it's hard to compare this to something else, but you won't be dissapointed in that department. Like other paradox titles this game uses the mouse movement swing mechanic, which is difficult to nail down, or completely unnecessary if you opt for the Berserker add on, for berserkers anyway, but after this you will come to enjoy the feedback and tightness of this system. I would recommend this to anyone who is a bit burned out on the endless FPS turn outs year after year, but still wants the satisfaction of respawning and dying, but truly living a good life and crushing your enemies.

reviewText:
I enjoy this game immensely. Since the alpha, I thought that the combat was, and still is, amazing, that the game looked great, and that the customization was heading in the right track, and it still is. So many people complain about how this game is dumbed down from WotR, and how shields are useless, and how archers are too overpowered. For starters, no, the game is not dumbed down, it is just a much faster paced game than WotR. So does that make it instantly bad? Absolutely not. And for those that say shields are useless, really? To those who say that: you are just mad that there is now a way to hit someone when they have a shield up, something you could not do in WotR. It is true, in WotR you were invincible with a shield until it broke (which took a while), and now there is a way to bypass the shield in this game. Does that make this game awful? Absolutely not. And now people are saying archers are overpowered? That is such a lie. You mean a fully charged shot can take away a lot of health? Just like a fully charged swing can? People are griping for the sake of griping.

The game is addictive, bottom line. Ever since early access I have been playing this game and falling in love with it. When I see people mindlessly complain how this game is not exactly like Warband or WotR I just want to hit them. This game is not Warband nor WotR, it is War of the god damn Vikings, and I would be lying if I said I do not have a lot of fun with this game. But is the game perfect? Of course not, no game is. At times the game gets a little choppy, but enough to make me want to throw my computer and spout obscenities? Not even close. As for the customization, it lacks when compared to WotR. But do you remember the customization in WotR when it first came out? I do, and it was not what it was today. So just be patient, because there will obviously be more options for customization later on.

So do I recommend this game? You better believe I do. Would I spend $25 on it? No, but I also would not spend that much on any game (I am cheap like that). If you see it for less than $20, get it. It is just such a fun game and I always look forward to playing more.

reviewText:
Hello everyone. I'm sorry to say, but I cannot recommend this game. You can see I'v played about nine hours of it, I played it when it was in beta, and it was broken then. Back in beta, hit detection, shields, and two handed weapons were broken. I thought since it was a beta, I would give it time, then the Shield maiden and Bezerker DLC rolled around, I didn't buy any of those DLC's but somehow I have the Shieldmaidens anyway.

Let's start with what I like about this game.

-Good and unique atmosphere, sound effects and music makes you think you're actually playing a Mid-eval Viking game.
-I do like class customization...But not enough here.
-I do like the tackle mechanics and the 'heavy attack'.
-I like the writing and stories behind every piece of armor and weapons.
-I do like the music and I like the Saxon voice actor, serious and grim.


Well, now that it's out of beta and now that I'm done with what I like...Playing it for a little bit It's worse then it was. Lag is horrible, the game is nearly dead, and whatever servers you do find are in other countries (I'm in the U.S and the only good server I could find was a Moscow one). Lag is horrible because you'll see people walking in a straight line with their weapons reared back, you swing at them, and then you're instantly on the ground dead. Hit detection is a joke because when you swing at someone, it doesn't even register. Shields don't even work either, I'l have the shield pointed RIGHT at someone and they can still go right through.

Two handed axes still swing bloody fast, just as fast as a one handed axe and do more damage. Don't even get me started on the Bezerkers...Not only do they have a 'cheat death' function to stay up after hitting 0 HP, they can go right through your blocks and shields too, and they swing like no tommorow, I even hit them while they were in Frenzy mode and they still would not die.

Overall, this game is broken, and dead. War of the Roses was and still is a very good game, at least it's partially free now. The devs of this game had the NERVE to add a cash shop to buy the utter lack of unique customization in this game, intentionally making the 'coin' gain slow. You can buy this game if you're curious, but you have been warned, stay away from it.

reviewText:
As one who have never played War of the Roses, I cannot compare the two. But, I found joy in the game, took me about half an hour to get used to the fighting, how to hit and dodge etc, but after that it went kind of smooth. There are a few times were you really want to toss your keyboard through the screen, etc. when you use your execution ability with a twohanded axe, but they're too close to be hit, or that it misses by an inch. I also like the diversity of classes, so no matter what suits your style best, you can pretty much find it. However, since I am only here in the free weekend, and haven't actually bought the game, I don't think I can modify the classes yet.

I personally liked the graphics, the gameplay overall was a nice experience, I however tend to get a faint headache when I am sprinting, due to the poor wobbley effect with the screen. Don't play it in a dark room as it just makes it all worse.

I think that is all I have for now, I will return if I stumble across anything more. Have a great night. :)

Edit: I have randomly been kicked out of the game, but that might aswell be because my video drivers weren't up to date. I would recommend you downloading the game over night and trying it in the free period, as that really is the best way to tell if you like it.

reviewText:
Have you ever wished there was a pvp game with modern day graphics and combat/design like gothic, mount and blade, or die by the sword? War of the Vikings is very reminiscent of these innovative games. Firstly in WotV, you are dropped into beautifully and maserfully done levels ranging from glaciers, caves, hilly villages, to  village cement tunnel trenches. The game wouldn't be complete without these gorgeous environments but it doesn't stop there.

Aimed to be created with historically accurate settings, weapons,  garbs/armor, and combat style, War of the Vikings will immerse you deeply. I have have been playing war of the roses since its beta and war of the vikings since the alpha early access too. Its always held a special place in my heart for multiple reasons. The combat is visceral, you can feel your sword cleave through people like a  butcher knife into a slab of meat. Place your hits well and you will be rewarded with a clean decapitation. Hitting a skilled opponent is no small accomplishment. The blocking system, although sometimes inconsistent, allows you to practically parry and deflect all attacks, if done skillfully. Aside from amazing fighting mechanics, graphics, and the best maps I have ever seen, war of the vikings offers swag as well as perks and a customization system.

The developers have simplified balancing by creating prestigious versions of each crude but equally efficient base weapon. Along with having swaggier versions of some of the more prestigious looking weapons, they come with a bio for the hero they belonged to or the era the weapon was famous for. The base weapons are offered for considerably lower prices to even out the playing field and make the game balance simple yet still customizable and the avatars personable to their owner. There are three classes, multiple perks which create multiple ways to play such as an archer, axeman, javelin hurler, backstabbing rogue, and much more. Theres enough swagger to drain thousands of hours of your time and keep you craving more inscribed finely crafted shiney pieces of loot.

Multiple game modes allow for basic team death match and more hardcore play with single life rounds as well as multiple others like conquest(territories). The game modes all have different feels and different meta tactics while using different parts of the environment for mini arenas amongst a gorgeous sandbox. Battle on a bridge to dominate the territory at the other end, or brawl for 15 mins straight until 125 kills in a sandy beach cave. Each mode takes advantage of the map layout and size.

The Devs definitely treated their previous fans well by giving them a 10% discount on the game as well as making them available with the discount in 4 packs. My friends and I all went in on this together and none of us regret it. The final product is well worth every dollar and even more. I thank the devs, Fat Shark, for making such an amazing game without slapping an expensive price tag on it.  Although the game has a steap learning curve and can be furstrating when getting crushed over and over by skilled opponents or bad spawns : (, I guarantee you will enjoy it and find extreme satisfaction once you learn the ropes. One of my favorite games and series of all time! 9.5/10. I will be looking forward to more from this developer and if they keep this kind of model and quality I will be a repeat customer and loyal supporter for decades to come!

reviewText:
Below is my review of the Alpha.

Here is my review of the final game: The combat is fast-paced, and the hit detection seems overall pretty good. However, and herein lies my major gripe with this game, all the customization is cosmetic only. Let me explain.

In War of the Roses, you could choose a heavier or lighter armor, and a weapon that had different characteristics: more range but slower, faster but less damaging, etc. The number of possible variations was incredible. In this game, there are many different weapons but they all have the same stats. All the 1h Swords are the same, except cosmetically, same thing with 1h axes, or 2h weapons.

This makes the whole idea of unlocking new things to try new combinations an asinine one, for it will only give you different LOOKS but will not offer you the challenge (and JOY!) of mastering a new custom class. It is the same stuff all over again.

Sure, the game is more balanced for it, but it is also much less interesting. Just wait for the anti-cheat on Roses to be implemented, it is a much, much better game IMO.

But then again, for just $15.00 this game might be worth a try if you think you can live with the bore of nothing new, ever.  EDIT: I just realized it is $25.00... For that price, stay away unless you are a die-hard fan of anything Viking or Saxon.

But for that reason, I will not recommend it as a purchase. Do so at your own risk, as this game is infinitely inferior to War of the Roses.

=====

Writing a review of the Alpha: this game looks to be as good as War of the Roses was, or could be, if it weren't for the legion of cheaters swarming the servers and ruining the fun for everyone. Because it is made by the same developers on a similar engine, I would be cautious about purchasing it, as if the developers do not address the cheating very specifically with this game, you can expect legions of cheaters as soon as the game launches, making it unplayable, or at least, unenjoyable.

For now at least, I'm giving it a cautious thumb up.

reviewText:
Haven't been playing long but I love this game already. If you're into the whole viking thing you'll be blown away by the whole experience.

There's a lot to appreciate here. The sound and visual environments are beautiful, the objective-based level structure is nice (albeit revolves around the usual capturing waypoints).  You can lose yourself for a bit in the character customization section, choosing weapons and perks to accompany fighting style.

It just feels so superb.

I feel awful for having one criticism - mainly because it's a core mechanic - but here I go:  the melee attack system. Blocking and archery both work very well, perfect even. The attack (click-n-swipe-mouse-direction similar to the one used in War of the Roses) just feels like a painful injustice to the rest of this game, I feel like i'm putting up with it for the sake of enjoying the rest of the game.

If they just completely axed (excuse the pun) this attack mechanic and went for something more natural (perhaps use a similar attack mechanic to Chivalry, which just works so well), I could see myself having exponentially more fun.

Eitherway, great piece of work so far, well done to everyone who's working on this - really look forward to playing more.

reviewText:
War of the Vikings is, generally, a decent game.
I have found that when playing with friends, the block system feels almost useless. The game lets you use either a shield or the weapon you're actually using to block. Both systems felt useless to my friends and I.
The shield is difficult to understand initially as it's so easy for your opponent to get around. The parrying has occasionally failed too. I've experienced failed blocks when I've block in the right direction, at the right time facing my enemy head on and it can be incredibly frustrating. The lag is also unbearable for me in 20-24 player games which is strange because my PC is rather high end.
Overall I'd still recommend it even if you give yourself smome frustrated bald patches.
voteText: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful

reviewText: This game either sticks for you or you hate it. It stuck with me. If you enjoy fast-paced combat where (despite claims to the contrary) skill plays an important role, this is for you. Note that that's skill, not necessarily reflexes. The man who better understands how to position himself at the start of a fight, when and how to strike, and when to go full defense will do much better in this than someone who wades in thinking he's invincible because he has twitchy reflexes.

reviewText: If they had gone forward in time from War of The Roses, perhaps 200ish years, instead of backward to the Vikings, the game might have been new and shiny and interesting, because having unblockable special attacks and slide dodges makes more sense during the age of black powder, war sabers, and elaborate pikes. But the player base most likely to play WOTV was the WOTR crowd, and things like handgonnes, cavalry, crossbows, and new melee weapons were what kept people interested. Removing all that variety for a sequel was a flawed concept.

reviewText:
The game is at this point effectively dead, after the contract between Fatshark and Paradox expanded there has been only one update which only brought in some quality-of-life improvements and updates to the anti-cheat system (during a brief period in which Paradox Arctic were working on the War franchise, this is however no longer the case.)

For this reason I am completely unable to recommend it regardless of the game's actual quality, if you are purchasing this you are purchasing a game with almost no players whatsoever.

Depending on news from Paradox regarding the future of existing titles within the War franchise the recommendation of this review may shift.

reviewText:
I do reccomend this game, however I will adress both sides starting with the bad, first a
Synopsis: of what you'll jump into you'll jump into a likley populated server and be attacked by many of the opposing team and you'll rage for a while but if you have some patience it will grow on you, you can't just give up the game like most of the negative reviewers do down below although I do see some of their points,

Bad: Yes it's like war of the roses but fixed, faster and fluid. The spawn system can be ♥♥♥♥ sometimes too for example you can spawn right in front/behind enemies and you'll be insta killed and the makers of this game released this in February and are still patching the ♥♥♥♥ out of this beautifully leaking faucet. TIP: if you're above 10 people on a small map get out of their unless  you like a bit of a scramble :P.

Good: The game works alot more fluid than WOTR you have a few classes to choose from if you just bought the game and don't have the DLC classes (I got them for free because I have a special edition version) If you have norse or anglo heritage you'll like the style and the art in the game, and it will take a lot of time to get used to even I as a rank 45 have ♥♥♥♥ days where I lose to a rank 11 user but if you have played WOTR you'll get the jist just not the speed. Lastly it's a recomended game if you have patience if you are easy to quit and just criticize because you're not winning you can ♥♥♥♥ off this is not the game for you then. 8/10 :D

reviewText: War of the Vikings' lack of content and instability issues have compromised the overall game experience, definitively killed by the lag.
voteText: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
-The customization (or lack thereforth) is poorer than in Chivalry, and WoTR was heavily appraised of a insane amount of customization. They screwed up this section completely, the customization being ♥♥♥♥-poor. Chivalry at least has different stats for different weapons for the same class, in here, absolutely everything is cosmetic. Everything. This is the biggest crap that the game delivers compared to WoTR.
-The game becomes obsolete after level 10; at level 10 you unlock the other set of perks. Perks is the only difference the game makes in choosing between different items of the same class.
-♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ class system; the game has a weird class system which gives the user certain passive abilities and so on and so forth. This is heavily linked to customization as it limits everything.
-Lack of optimization; this is subjective as anyone with a good PC WILL run it but the game does not justify looking that good on lowest settings for being unable to keep up a constant 60 fps on a GTX 460.
-Special attacks for everyone; archers and berzerkers should not have a special attack, it completely neuters the point of those classes to begin with, not to mention how op berzerkers are to begin with.
-Throwing weapons; this idea was objectively stolen from Chivalry, and even in Chivalry it was a bad mechanic. It simply allows everyone to deal damage despite being close-combat focus class before you even reach them. If anything, berzerkers should actually be the only class that would allow throwing weapons.
-No point for a secondary sword; in WoTR your weapons were able to break, in here, your weapon never breaks so you can just block infinitely, the point of a secondary weapon as a close-combat weapon is neutered, being replaced by the throwing weapons.
-Bad netcode for blocking; in WoTR this was also the issue, but it was more acceptable as blocking was done faster and was more vivid, allowing for a high skill ceiling and a well-fledged fend and spin and everything combat which entirely based about skill, concentration and blocking well. In here, blocking becomes fairly obsolete in fast encounters, not working most of the time. Not to mention that blocking a berzerker is either impossible, or useless as they can just keep attacking you over and over again.
-Last Stand for berzerkers; this is the bane of 1v1 combat, and even otherwise. Unless you deal a insta kill, that guy has more than 100 hp.
-No more hilt; WoTR had a nice hilt system, where the polearms (here, particularly axes since the game has about 5 different weapons to bloody choose from) could hit with the wood instead of the weapon itself, essentially not dealing any damage, in here, as long as it's in your range, you hit it.
-Poor perk system; perks are very poor in comparison, I would've expected something like bandage faster, rise up after being revived faster, being able to block special attacks (that would be useful), and maybe more than just 2 bloody perk slots in general. Once more, something which was done very well by WoTR.
-All classes pretty much have the same armor level, a champion seems to have the same armor as anyone else.
-No armor mechanics; WoTR had armor mechanics where you can hit someone and not penetrate their armor, given the lack of (any) armor customization, the devs decided to simply make anything go through anything.
-DLC classes; are you ♥♥♥♥ing serious?

This game is a massive pile of ♥♥♥♥. In it's own right, if you are to take it apart for a new player who never played such a game before, it's a enjoyable massive pile of ♥♥♥♥. But at the same time it's a heavily dumbed down WoTR. If anyone was to choose between this and WoTR, WoTR would be the way to go.
The only good the game excels in is combat impact: It does feel a lot better to hit someone in here than in WoTR. But that does not cut it at all since it's purely cosmetic.

reviewText:
Such a downgrade from War of the Roses. The biggest disappointment to me is that they removed the customization system which is the backbone of WotR. Sure, there are hundreds of different weapons for each class but they all have the same stats and handle the exact same way - essentially there's just a bunch of copies of the same few weapons. The armor customization has more or less been removed as well as there are now three classes with fixed armor types.

Worth mentioning is that the game seems to be almost abandoned by now, both by the developers and the community. There are hardly any active servers and very few players online (I don't blame them). This is obviously a problem since it's purely a multiplayer game.

I could mention a lot more features that have been removed and/or fubared but my disappointment has cooled off since I'm writing this roughly a year after release and I frankly can't be bothered.

tl;dr - You're better off with War of the Roses or Chivalry if you're looking for games in this genre.

reviewText:
In short: Do not buy. Dev team left the franchise to rot because they are not making enough money out of it. (Which they only got themselves to blame for! They haven't put enough effort into patching the game but more importantly the marketing of this game was crap.)

The story so far:

Alpha -> Beta (problems...) -> Release (More problems....) -> Patch 1.4 (New content, lots of bugs were fixxed!!!) -> 1.5 (Current build. They made shields buggy with passive blocking, they nerfed archery very hard and parrying is broken. Besides that the hit detection is crap thanks to very bad netcode. for 1.5 they got a new netcode that had more potential to be upgraded than the 1.4 one, but the problem is they never upgraded the 1.5 so it basicly is 10x worse than 1.4....)

The community that is left (Aprox. 100-120 players, of which 25 play tops at the same time) cried out to the devs multiple times. Paradox has too much pride to even reverse the damage done and refuses to downgrade to 1.4!
Game is broken, avoid this game at all costs until further notice... (probably never!)

reviewText: War of the Vikings is one of the latest medieval fighting games out there and one of the only featuring badass vikings and  whiny saxons. Despite what many people will have you believe, this game is amazing. It features awesome swordfighting mechanics and has a very impressive graphical style. The many bad reviews here are just like many of the bad reviews given to Chivalry: Medieval Warfare. Those reviews are usually given by people who don't know how to play the game. Once you learn the mechanics, and use parrying (I recomend starting with the shield) correctly, you will be amazed by how much fun you can have. But, as expected from an Early Access" game
recommended: and it does struggle with a few annoying bugs that needs to be fixed
hoursPlayed: although those are not major game-breaking ones. The game is still in beta
voteText: and the developers have promised the players more features and far better mechanics that are more solid. I absolutely recommend this game to anyone
helpfulPercent: especially if you enjoyed Chivalry: Medieval Warfare and/or War Of The Roses. The game is cheaper now then what it will be at its final release in early 2014

reviewText:
Despite all the hate comments there are to this game, I really do recommend this to be bought of you. The reviews are a bit old, and there has been fixed alot of bugs in the past time.

The game is incredibly fun to play, and does have an amazing combat system. There is alot you can customize on your character in the game, both the looks, and the perks. The most incredible customize in my wiew is the shield that you can carry with you.

You can either play as Vikings or Saxons (Anglo Saxons). There are no diffrence to these teams, despite there is some religious commentators of both teams, really have some hatred comments to the different team.

I think the combat system is incridible, because it does acquire skill the be 'the king of of the battle'. The first battle I was in, i really got cripples on my back, chopping Saxon heads off with my axe, and all the blood there was.

There REALLY is a great mood and feeling to it when you first rage out to your enemies, releasing rage cries and hatred comments to the other team.


There REALLY is alot great to say about the game despite the hatred comments there is on this game. I would say, that you should give it a chance, and see if it maybe will catch your interest. I bought it despite the negative comments, and it really did a great job in making this my ALL TIME favorite game.

reviewText:
Don't be fooled by some of the shoddy reviews done of this game out there (I'm looking at you IGN -.-). This is Call of Duty meets Medieval Times in a good way. A squeal of sorts to War of the Roses and similar to Chivalry and the multilayer portion of Mount and Blade.
The game is third person and boasts a progression system of weapons and armour. Most of the upgrades are cosmetic but different types of weapons and perks can also be unlocked as you earn gold, which acts like spendable xp, at the end of each match. The game boasts different classes the default being three, but quickly unlocked is the ability to choose your own load-out of weapons and perks. Teams are always Vikings vs Saxons, but the only difference between the two sides gameplay wise is their different appearance and vocalizations. Matches support up to 32 players but most servers limit player count to 24 which is a more comfortable fit for the map sizes.
In comparison to War of the Roses the game still has that extra mile of historical authenticity for all the history buffs out there (one of the end game unlockables for the Vikings is an Uthbert Swortd!)  The game looks considerably prettier ditching the washed out look for a brighter and more colourful appearance, and the detail on the armour and weapons is impressive. The biggest casualty in features from War of the Roses is mounts which is a bit of a shame but does fit the time period especially given the lack of lances. The familiar mouse driven swinging and blocking is back but overall has been streamlined to the games benefit. For example, the stab attack and block action has been removed but this only makes the game simpler and lowers the learning curve a bit for new players. Furthermore the bow is mercifully much easier to aim compared to War of the Roses with arrows dipping much less below the cross-hair over distance. Special attacks with the 'F' key on the other hand are new and very based on what weapon is equipped. While powerful if missed they can leave you dangerously open for a brief time after for a counter so you must be careful not to over employ them and wait for the right moment.
The sounds and music of the game is top notch. On the other hand despite an extensive beta at this time there are still few bugs lingering about, such as spawning too near enemies, but they are rare enough to not pose too much of an issue. Meanwhile there is a fairly basic game-mode variety but a healthy number of maps featuring a number of gorgeous locations with for example Saxon towns to crumbled stone ruins in an autumn forest acting as the backdrop. The combat is satisfyingly brutal with occasional decapitations and blood effects and feels visceral as opposed to floaty such as combat in the Elder Scrolls games for instance. The swing of your two handed axe looks and feels satisfyingly heavy upon striking the chainmail of your foe.
Keep in mind the game is only a multilayer offering, but if you like first person shooters like Titanfall or Call of Duty and the idea of s third person medieval setting this game might appeal to you. Similarly if you don't like those afore mentioned fps' this games different take of hand to hand combat might tickle your fancy. Bear in mind the game has a difficulty similar to those fps' however.
If you have an itch to play out some realistic medieval skirmishes, and don't a bit of learning curve if you haven’t played this style of game before, this game is worth the $25 asking price.
Grab a horn of mead, say a prayer to Odin, and charge into the fray. 8.0/10 (Great)

reviewText:
Despite all the hate comments there are to this game, I really do recommend this to be bought of you. The reviews are a bit old, and there has been fixed alot of bugs in the past time.

The game is incredibly fun to play, and does have an amazing combat system. There is alot you can customize on your character in the game, both the looks, and the perks. The most incredible customize in my wiew is the shield that you can carry with you.

You can either play as Vikings or Saxons (Anglo Saxons). There are no diffrence to these teams, despite there is some religious commentators of both teams, really have some hatred comments to the different team.

I think the combat system is incridible, because it does acquire skill the be 'the king of of the battle'. The first battle I was in, i really got cripples on my back, chopping Saxon heads off with my axe, and all the blood there was.

There REALLY is a great mood and feeling to it when you first rage out to your enemies, releasing rage cries and hatred comments to the other team.


There REALLY is alot great to say about the game despite the hatred comments there is on this game. I would say, that you should give it a chance, and see if it maybe will catch your interest. I bought it despite the negative comments, and it really did a great job in making this my ALL TIME favorite game.

reviewText: After playing through Dark Souls again and finding out hat the PvP isn´t that active anymore i was looking for another sword fighting game to play before DS II comes out. I looked into Chivalry and War of the Roses - Both are alright but didn´t click with me (yet). Then i bought War of the Vikings pretty much out of the blue and for the first few hours i couldn´t really get into it as well but the solid presentation, graphics, animations, music and great audio in general kept me coming back. I am now still only 12 hours in but yeah, it clicked. I am getting a hang of the gameplay and i really start to enjoy this game a lot. If you haven´t played M&B or War of the Roses before or even -like me- switched back from console to PC, be prepared for a steep learning curve and a lot of failing battles...but if you stick with it you WILL get better obviously. It might take a little longer to get a feeling for the game than with some other games - but it´s worth your time because when you finally get a hang of it, the game starts to reveal it´s true beauty. Recommended, definitely - But not for everybody i think...

reviewText:
This dark age romp is fun, frustrating,  cut-throat,  hectic  and precise all at once. It is the precision that makes it worthwhile as it relies on the player improving their own play style to advance. In this way its quite similar to dark souls (It also has paralells with the themes and stamina bar).

The double-handed axes are horrendously overpowered and the price/level-based unlocks for items is way too high IMHO.

On the good side the agile fighter ability is awesome and it has some good co-op elements.

All in all it makes for a fun time waster but the lack of an ability to rage quit easily means you should probably buy some protection for your monitor.

Oh and VIKINGS. Duh. Awesome.

reviewText: The gameplay is reasonably good.  The learning curve is steeper than most other FPS games but putting in the time can be rewarding.  Unfortunately, the game is too frequently ruined by lag/ping issues.  Your opponent is totally vulnerable and you release a strike and watch as it goes right thru with no effect.  I'm not sure how they can settle this issue but the game becomes unplayable on a consistent basis when pings rise above 150 - 180 ms.  Otherwise, it's a decent effort by fatsharl/paradise.

reviewText:
First off, let me just say this game is INSANELY fun.  The sound effects are fantastic, a javelin going through your skull makes such a satisfying crunch even you enjoy your own death.  It has a nice method of giving you control over your melee, instead of random side swings and such.  Maps are all good, though it seems it rotates around 4 a lot more often than any others.  Each weapon has a nice feel to it to make it unique, and the amount of cosmetic options for your character is great, shield painting mode makes me feel like I am creating my own house sigil.
HOWEVER there are a few things that irk me about the game, that I feel need to be addressed, and if any of these would REALLY bug you, maybe reconsider until they are fixed.

SPAWNING: It is something that should no be that hard to manage, but I cannot describe how annoying it is to spawn, and a half second later to have an enemy soldier spawn right behind you and hack you to pieces.  Or to spawn mid-battle right in someones swing arc, literally making a half second life and just tacking on to the K/D spread and a free point for the other team (or minus a point if it was a teammates arc).

BALANCE: Still fun and playable with all weapons, but from the time I have played is seems the dominating players ALWAYS use 2H axes, and spears are utterly useless.  yes, the fact that a 2H does more damage makes sense, but it seems that not having a shield is not enough of a disadvantage when using one.  Make it so all weapons have their own advantages and disadvantages to make them all useable and viable.

DOWNED ENEMIES: 80% of the time when you deplete and enemies health they are not dead, they are downed".  This means they cannot move
date: and are kneeling or lying on the ground waiting to respawn or for a teammate to help them up.   While more interesting for the person who has been hurt
recommended: they can hope a friendly comes by and heals them.  However it is annoying when you down someone and an archer snipes in and steals your kill while you deal with another enemy.  A simple fix to this is an easy rearrange to the point system
hoursPlayed: when player 1 downs an enemy
voteText: and player 2 kills him
helpfulPercent:
the kill points should be split between the players rather than all of them going to player 2.

*The next one doesn't NEED to be fixed but could cause frustration for some*

FRIENDLY DAMAGE: In the week I have had this game
votesHelpful: I have caused more friendly damage
votesTotal: and taken more friendly damage than in every other multiplayer game I have ever played combined.  Since it is close quarters combat
votesFunny: it makes sense
commentsCount: a stray sword swing
column16: a player running into my arrow arc
column17: it is going to happen.  From what I have seen so far the community has accepted it
column18: I have never seen anger or yelling over friendly damage
column19: and there is no booting as far as I can tell.  However it is very frustrating when I make a nice quick 4 kill streak without taking any damage
column20: and someone comes in and tries to kill my downed enemies and decapitates me in the process.  Some are more mindful of their surroundings than others."

reviewText: I went into WotV expecting a WotR with all new armors and environments, yet upon entering the game I realised that they took it to a whole new level. Combat flows perfectly; the pace is brutal, the mechanics are polished, and the battlefield just feels so much more impressive.\nWar of the Vikings actually adds some noteworthy mechanics to the FPS genre, which revolutionise melee combat from the old warband slasher. Here you can dodge strikes, crouch and raise your shield, throw weapons and see them boucing off hard surfaces, shield blocking is actually difficult, and you can hear your friendlies chatter when something happens around you. You can even spin with your one-handed axe in hand and sever your opponents head.\nVery recommended at this point, for any warband or medieval FPSlasher fans.

reviewText: 8/10\n\nHaven't spent as much time as I'd like on this game so far, but it is one of my current favorites. I'm a huge fan of Viking related things, so that made it even more fun. There is a steep learning curve and the skill gap is obvious so be warned, this isn't some multiplayer Skyrim. Once you do learn the combat it's really rewarding taking out more experienced players. What I would like to see is either a boost in coins gained, or a price cut on the items. Grinding for cosmetic items is fun for a short time, but gets discouraging after a while when you see the coin gain after each match is a fraction of the cost of what you want. Especially when you're only able to play the game few hours a week.

reviewText: Playing any game requires learning the rules. how to interact with the world, the other players, and with the tools provided. This game is pretty unique. It deviates from the standard Mount and Blade/War of the Roses combat, but its still similar enough that experience from either of those games will be helpful. You swing the weapons by moving your mouse in one of three directions (no thrusting in this one :P ) while simulataneously left-clicking. You hold the click to charge the power of your swing. (you can also just click and release which willl do a weaker swing) All the rest of combat comes from being able to time attacks and judge the distance between you and your enemy. It is a game that takes awhile to get used to, but if you enjoy the mechanics it's alot of fun to play. I have probably 500 something hours between this game, War of the Roses, and the Mount and Blade franchise, so I really like the combat stlye. This game isn't perfect by any stretch of the imagination, but I love what's there. I would recommend this game to anyone that likes action games, and wants a challenging, brutal experience.

reviewText:
This game is quite similar to War of the Roses.
Maps are quite small, combat is fast, not as much running till you meet enemies as in WotR, but sometimes enemies can invade your spawn points and sometimes right after you spawn, enemies are behind you.

Blocking is good, shields break, manual weapon blocking, attack directions are basic 3? maybe with sword 4.
There is special attack for weapons, not for bows tho.
Bow is good, you have to adjust to gravity and enemy movement, arrows take their time, too.

I'd recommend this game over Chivalry with it's bugs and awful (shield) blocking system.

reviewText:
Much faster paced than War of the roses. Still has some crashing issues, and spots of lag. The game plays faster than even Chivalry-MW.
I liked it enough that I put 15 hours into it on my first weekend (Sat-Sun) or about 1/2 of what I spent playing WoTR already.
Roses was, and still is a solid game but both of these play completely different.

Where Roses was slower and more about well placed attacks and well timed blocks, Vikings is a faster. Its more focused on mobility and avoiding blows instead of blocking them. It still has its small issues, but its a pretty sold game.
The visuals are amazing, the battle sounds are also pretty good. Music (when it plays) is very fitting to the game and really adds to the feel" when you play.

So far the game is lacking on character customization options compared to roses

reviewText:
Fantastic game, strikes a good balance between the satisfying hits of Chivalry and the more believable mechanics of War of the Roses. The only noteable downsides are:
Low population- It seems that the game is coming fairly close to release and there's still not a whole lot of players. In the afternoons/early night there's usually 2-3 servers in America I can join. Later in the night, after midnight or so there's literally no American servers to play on.
Not much customization- If you played War of the Roses you may expect a similar level of customization and sadly that's not the case yet. Choice of helmets and weapons are few, and there's no choice of armor at all, beyond choosing your color scheme.
Overall, I still think it's the best game of it's kind. The core mechanics are really solid, and combat is very satisfying, but if you buy it you should understand the likely future of the game is either a graveyard or free-to-play. They've said they won't do the latter but time will tell if they have a choice.
voteText: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game has a very promising concept: “Take Vikings and put them up against Saxons in multiplayer, melee combat.” However it is an utter disappointment.

The net code is horrible; causing your weapon swings to rarely connect with the enemy and pass through them like they were made of air. When it comes down to attacking, it almost feels like you can’t do so unless the game wishes you to while you come under fire from rapid sword attacks from your enemy.

I regret ever spending money on this game. While I played it in Early Access alpha, it felt like it had a lot of promise, however nothing has really changed from then and now other than the customization options which is limited at best.

Spend your money on something else. Don’t buy this game because you will be allowing the developers to rob you of your money.

reviewText:
DISCLAIMER:

I do not own War of the Roses/Mount & Blade. However! I do own Chivalry(similar mechanis).

Summary: I think the game is fun. It's also quite pacey/quick compared to, say, Chivarly.
I've found there is a lot less chatting on the game. Why? Because people are constantly busy. On Chivarly, the speed is much slower so there's a lot of BS chatting, which is an indication that people are not really engaged.

If you've never played a similar-typed game, then this is a good place to start.
There are not too many maps, but this is still being added, month by month.

There's also a good mix between being independent and dependent on teamwork. You can play roles in your match, depending upon your preferences of the moment.

I'd wait for a steam sale. To get this game under 10 dollars/euros is not a bad deal.
8/10.

reviewText:
Well, I bought War of the Roses a few days ago, and then I saw this, thinking it might be similar.


The gameplay is similar, more optimized, and runs smoother, but 80% of what I like about War of the Roses is not in the game in any way, and 95% of what I don't like about it is still present.

The customization for your character in War of the Vikings boils down to what kind of weapon do you want. You can pick between 5 different categories of weapons, from bows to two handed axes. Unfortunately, there seems to be absolutely no way to tell if there's any difference between different weapons of the same class without buying them and playing with them. As far as I can tell, weapons are just for show, while the damage is roughly the same. And the weapon selection is very small. It boils down to the same weapon with different tiers, with the higher ones being more pretty.

But of course, no one really pays any attention to that as you are decapitated in one fell stroke by a two-handed axe, because, oh that's right, you're forced into one of three classes, with their own abilities. There is no armor selection from what I can tell, and armor is irrelevant to gameplay, since you can be decapitated in  one hit whether you're wearing the heavy mail of the Champion or the cloth of the Skirmisher.

With the release date around the corner, I don't see any indication that any more customization is going to be added in, especially for armor.

Some nice features are included, such as dodging, and sprinting, and some throwing weapons that can be ridiculous at times. But they drown in the sea of axe murderers all wearing the same three things.

reviewText:
Ok to start with I would like to point out the fact that this game was great i Alpha and Beta.
Since I was on holiday for a long time and got back it was released in full (finally)
First couple of months it was great!
But then...
The updates were endless and the contant was lacking, then came the breakable shields and ghost hits.
But then suddenly after almost a year without any updates then there was update 1.6!

This fixed alot of issues:
Most ghost hits
I havent crashed once since the update

But what I dont get is what is the point of having all the different swords and axes when buying and equiping them don't change stats?

It's a good game but honestly it's not worth the trouble.

reviewText: This game shows promise at an early glimpse. I was fortunate to download it during its free access weekend on Steam, this weekend. I've generally enjoyed myself as I was familiair with the IP from games such as Medieval: Chivarly, War of Roses and smaller spin-offs. Due to the games status, the current build is very glitchy and can have you upset at times. Your swing may miss or your block might not block! However, we live in a time where we purchase our product before it's even complete, so we can't expect anything different. Despite its technical flaws, the game is gorgeous and if you have the build for it I recommend you crank up the settings, you'll want to experience it.\n\nThe game isn't out yet so I won't give you my full review. I will definitely encourage fans of Medieval to purchase now before it comes up so save your wallet a tad bit (it will thank you). In its current stage you've got the ability to use classes, a wide variety of weapons/skill-sets and yeah - games simply fun to play. Have fun and enjoy!

reviewText:
This game is beautiful and a pleasure to play.  Unlike many fps, this is not a reflex game. indeed it took me a while to slow down and plan out assaults.  The best team ALWAYS wins so teamwork is really emphasised.

The thing I like best, given a bunch of new players, a 2 on 1 is not always a deathsentence like so many other games.  Indeed, I saw a guy beat 4 other players who had poor teamwork.  He was a wizard with his axe, but it was fun to play.

One final bit of praise...archery is thrilling! there is arrow drop and you have to lead the targets, so much to consider.  A single arrow, indeed two or even three might not be fatal, but a head shot isn't auto death either...you have to take into account your pull.  I really enjoyed this game and plan on buying it when it is released.

reviewText:
Ohhhhh.... Where to start with this awesome game.....


This is the sword fighting game that we have all been hoping for on Steam. It's fast, it's vicious, and it's diverse. There are probably around 30+ weapons in this game to use. Narrowed down the weapon choices are: one handed sword, one handed axe, two handed axe, spear, bow, throwing weapons, and probably a lot more that I forgot about or are going to be added like two handed swords. Now, in each one of these weapon catigories there is probably around 5 to 10 individual different weapons in there to use. Beyond that, there's armor customization, shield customization, beard customization, and armor pattern customization. I haven't even gotten to the combat yet!

If you're hesitating to get this game because it's dubbed the sequal of war of the roses, and war of the roses was bad. Slap yourself, now, with a fish. It's been vastly improved. You can charge up a weapon to do more damage, but you have to time it correctly to do more damage, or wait too long and you do less. Blocking and fighting use the same movements, you move your mouse and left click to swing in a certain direction, left = left swing, right= right swing, up = overhead swing. The same can be said for blocking just correspond with the direction it's coming from. Shields are also in no way overpowered, they can be easily bypassed by swinging for the legs or head. You may think this is boring, but each weapon gets a special attack to mix it up a little more and do more damage at the cost of if you miss it'll take a moment to be able to recover. Did I also mention there's a perk system? The perk system is fairly balanced like the rest of the game, it's just small things, like killing an enemy can refund 25% health, and if you're chasing a sprinting enemy you move 25% faster. Oh yeah, are you annoyed by enemies that just turn tail and run? In this game you can chase after them and tackle them from behind, and give them some well deserved slashes to the face while they try to stand back up. Another thing, bows are not overpowered either, they at most do around 60 damage, but they're a pain to aim and shoot and you're kinda dead if an enemy wanders close with a sword because you can't block or shoot the bow very quickly to kill them.

All in all, this is a beyond perfect game, I would recommend it to anyone that wants to experience great feeling medieval-like combat. I probably have missed some other good stuff in this review to give you some surprises if you do get the game :D
I promise on my honor, that there's no groundbreaking bug, or experience ruining hackers. So please! Join in on the amazing game that is War of the Vikings!

reviewText:
If you were looking for a skill based melee fighting game, well, you haven't found it. This is a lot more of a hack and slash kind of fighting game. Yes, you can try to parry and dodge but you won't gain much by doing so. This game unfortunately feels like a dumbed-down version of War of the Roses, where the fastest person wins and actually trying to play well by parrying and blocking does very little to help you.

The combat is based around choosing one of three character classes, the Warrior (jack of all trades), the Champion (melee) and the Skirmisher (ranged). Each class gets its own armor which cannot be changed, and a few different customization options. The combat works a little differently than in War of the Roses, as this time there are only three directions for melee attacks; Up, left and right. There are also special attacks unique to each class of weapon which will instantly kill an opponent. You'd think that these attacks would be hard to pull off, but you'd be wrong. It is incredibly easy to score instant kills with the special attacks (which are mostly unblockable by the way), which only serves to make the combat feel even less about skill and more about who can score the first hit. All attacks will also do quite a bit of damage, so you are able to kill in around 3 very fast hits usually, making combat very fast paced and dangerous, There is no room for slower, more calculated duels in this game, and basically the best way to play is to just swing blindly at opponents or try to hit them with an instakill special attack.

If you want to play as a ranged fighter this is one area where the game does play quite well, as there is some skill involved in scoring successful shots with a bow or throwing weapons, and this can make ranged combat quite fun.

The weapon customization in this game is quite well done as there are a lot of different weapon designs to choose from. However, all the weapons within a class will all have exactly the same stats no matter which weapon you pick, the only differences are cosmetic ones. The character customization I feel is somewhat lacking. You can choose a few different helmet designs, and give your character a beard or cloak, but that's about it. You canot change your armor as it is set when you choose one of the three character classes.

Also, all customization options require coins to unlock, with most also having a level requirement. Coins are gained through your actions on the battlefield, similar to experience. It takes quite a while to earn a good few coins and items tend to be quite expensive, so gaining the coins you need to, say, give your character a new beard, can feel like quite a grind.

All in all I wouldn't recommend this game as it does just feel like a dumbed-down version of War of the Roses, with less satisfying combat mechanics and less customization. It can be quite entertaining under some circumstances, but in my opinion, is not worth your time or money.

4/10

reviewText: It's a pretty good game. It has a lot of fairly major problems with the combat system, but it's definitely a major step up from the clickfest that was War of the Roses. It's still leagues behind Mount & Blade in pretty much everything but music and visuals though. I recommend it if you have an interest in pre-medieval British history, as the aesthetic is pretty well done, even if it's not that realistic playing.\n\nShields are atrocious though and should never be used for anything but blocking arrows until they give them a much needed boost. How could they make them so bad.

reviewText: I am 25 years old and I have been playing games most of my life. I have been waiting for a good Viking themed game for years. There have been many attempts at it some were decent but none have made my Scandinavian heart sing. But this game has. The music (If there is a way to purchase the soundtrack sign me up), the combat, the style, everything fills me with joy. I know it is a long shot but if you can figure out a way to integrate a story line or campaign could honestly say my gamer dream has come true. I have a deep love for Norse mythology and its people. My family heritage is traces back to Scandinavian vikings. My ancestors were explorers and fighters all the way up to their immigration to america and I have always loved and respected my heritage.\n\nI am a loyal follower of the gods and I pay tribute to them every morning and every night. Obviously the old ways are gone but to me the pride just to know my bloodline descends from the vikings. This game deserves more exposure and I will do my part to get all my friends in on this experience. I will follow this game till its final release. I have purchased the standard edition to test the waters but after hours of gameplay I will be getting the Valhalla edition now.

reviewText:
I left this game for almost a year and am finally coming back only to see that nothing has changed

The enviorment is so intensive that medium and low end pcs cant even navigate the menue smoothly even with all seetings turned off or on low.  The only thing that turning things off seems to do is put it in windowed but it dosent take the graphics down or up. basically...its

would you like max settings on fullscreen or windowed"....

cuz there is no change in the two regardless of the setting change. Fat shark has either done a very poor and crappy job or they just dont care and this entire game is a money scam.  The previous game of War of the Roses underwent multiple changes and updates and now runs perfectly and is a joy to play even in the face similar fps issues early on...sooo.... why has the deveoper completly abandoned this game?  With fps at times under 8fps its hard to even walk around in a game that at its core needs fps to be a priority.  At this point it is "let the man with the nicest pc win" because anyone with a pc that is under $2
date: 000 seems to be ♥♥♥♥ed because the game requires such a high end pc to play.  Maybe its the enviorment or maybe its the models....not 100% sure.....but this game desperatly needs someone to go back and fix the glaring fps issues.  People are reporting swings that miss for no reason or fail to connect at random times....hit boxes out of place and very unbalanced classes and game items.  How can a developer let this stuff just go by the wayside and just not care?  One thing is for certain...i will never be buying any more games by this developer because of their poor job and "♥♥♥♥ you" attitude towards the community.\n\nI would strongly encourage anyone who has bought or is considering buying this game to not buy it and never support this deveolper again.  They DO NOT LISTEN and could care less about fixing issues within their game."

reviewText:
After playing it can be said that the War of rose much better.
1. Total Class 3 1-2 are different skills and armor that reduces damage in % no matter what weapon to beat .
2. From the whole set of skills available only useful 2-3.
3. Weapons unlike War of rose it can not improve. have the choice of 4 for each type of which only one normal and one a top that is expensive. The type of weapon does not does not affect the penetration of armor .
4. Since unlike War of rose no matter what part of the weapons you get all the fights are reduced to stupid spam. Special - hitting wretchedly get them is not so easy as many kickbacks lead to death .
5. Customization of your character at the moment is wretched . Armor does not change weapon not improve . Skills on a little influence . In addition that allows you to automatically select the direction of the block that just kills selection system side lock .
Of Pius can be noted more realistic embroidered blocks and improved graphics .
I think that the game is not currently worth the money really buy ray War of rose.
Let the game is still in early access but the official release will change little .

Поиграв в это можно сказать что War of rose намного лучше.
1. Всего 3 класса которые отличны 1-2 навыками и броней которая понижает вред в % и не важно каким оружием бить.
2. Из всего набора навыков доступных полезны только 2-3.
3. Оружие в отличии от War of rose его нельзя улучшать. Есть на выбор по 4 на каждый тип из которых только 1 нормальное и 1 топовое которое стоит дорого. Также тип оружия не как не влияет на пробивание доспеха.
4. Так как в отличии от War of rose неважно какой частью оружия ты попал все бои сводятся к тупому спаму. Спец-удары убоги попасть ими не так просто а долгие откаты приводят к смерти.
5. Кастомизация персонажа на данный момент убога. Броню не поменять оружие не улучшить. Навыки мало на что влияют. Не считая того который позволяет автоматически выбирать направления блока что просто убивает систему выбора стороны блокировки.
Из пюсов можно отметить только более реалистичные блоки шитом и улучшенную графику .
Считаю что игра на данный момент не стоит своих денег уж луче купить War of rose.
Пусть игра еще в раннем доступе но официальный выход мало что изменит.

reviewText: Fantastic game overall with a few issues but nothing some patches wouldn't fix. If you actualy take the time to learn the combat system and not cry when you get stomped by a better player you will grow to enjoy the game. Alot of the negative reviews are from people who have played for 5 seconds, gotten frustrated when they get killed because they are new, then went and ranted on the forums or something. It has a great community full of players that are very willing to help newbies out and teach them the ropes.

reviewText:
Do not be fooled, this game is garbage.
I really expected more from Paradox here
Mount and blade multiplayer is WAY better than this, more modes, larger servers and mods
they must have put the servers in the middle of the ocean on an oil rig, i cannot find a server with anything lower than 100ping

The hackers and exploits in this game are rampant and apparently we are less than a month from release

This game is an appaling failure and certain to have rough times ahead

Everyones uses axes making basically every other weapon type useless as it has so many obvious advantages

I have played countless Paradox titles and enjoyed many early access games and i have to  honestly say that there is no game here.
The entire gameplay is just 20+ guys swinging axes and really looses any value after about 15 or 20 mins.

Again keep in mind this mess is less than a month away from release and they have a whopping 3 classes and 2 maps and zero game play.

The quality of graphics was although much better than Mount and Blade but still far far below industry standards

I will be uninstalling the game and will not be following its future as i am quite certian its does not have one.
